description: The subsystem follows a Service-Oriented pattern tailored for VS Code's extension host. The core flow is governed by a reactive state synchronization model: the `Extension Lifecycle Orchestrator` initializes services in a strictly ordered sequence, starting with the `Binary Management Service` to ensure local processing capabilities. Once active, the `Analysis Orchestrator` executes the heavy-lifting static analysis via external binaries, while the `Global State Synchronizer` maintains a single source of truth (`StateManager`). This state is then propagated to the `Diagram View Controller` and `DetailsViewProvider` via an event-driven observer pattern, ensuring that the graph visualization and detail panels remain consistent regardless of whether the user interacts with the sidebar or a maximized editor panel.

components.name: Extension Lifecycle Orchestrator
components.description: The central entry point that manages the dependency injection and initialization order of all extension services.

components.name: Binary Management Service
components.description: Implements the local-first bias by downloading platform-specific binaries and managing execution permissions.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Coordinates the execution of static analysis processes and handles LLM usage tracking/quota management.

components.name: Global State Synchronizer
components.description: Provides a centralized, event-driven state store that bridges disparate UI components like the sidebar and webview panels.

components.name: Command & View Bridge
components.description: An abstract layer handling webview messaging, theme synchronization, and Git status enrichment for graph nodes.

components.name: Diagram View Controller
components.description: Manages the specific lifecycles of VS Code `WebviewView` (sidebar) and `WebviewPanel` (editor) instances.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
